events.title: An eBike for the Dog
events.subtitle: January 2021
events.heading: true
events.description: I bought an electric tricycle so my dog could get some excercise, and from that point on I've been hooked on eBikes. He was getting fat and I have a bum knee so I couldn't walk him. The trike with a trailer allowed me to easily get him out and about without straining my knee.

events.title: Covered Dog Trailer
events.subtitle: Spring 2021
events.description: The dog needed protection from the hot Mojave sun so I covered the trailer with some old flexible solar panels. They weren't connected to anything but were lightweight and would withstand exposure to the sun well.

events.title: The Experimentation Begins
events.subtitle: Summer 2021
events.description: Over the summer I experimented with using the solar panels on the dog trailer to charge the bike battery. I wanted to power microcontrollers and WiFi devices on the bike and trailer for security 24x7 and didn't want to drain the battery in the process.

events.title: Open Source Bike Launched
events.subtitle: August 2021
events.description: I was sharing some of my experiences with solar ebikes and microcontrollers on social media and wanted to add some structure to that sharing. To that end, opensourcebike.com was launched as a hosted Wordpress site.

events.title: Focused on Solar
events.subtitle: Fall 2021
events.description: Over the fall I worked on determining the feasibility of charging a bicycle while in use. I was sharing more and more content on social media and the website and wasn't happy with either experience.

events.title: Going BIG and Staying Home
events.subtitle: Winter 2021
events.description: I continued sharing as I built the largest solar trailer I could comfortably tow with a bicycle. I realized I was becoming dependent upon the various `free` cloud services, and getting content back out of them wasn't easy.

events.title: Working on a Better Way to Share
events.subtitle: Spring 2022
events.description: The focus moved to finding a better way to collect and share project data. I wanted something builders and makers could use easily. I also wanted something extrmely flexible and programmer friendly.

events.title: TachyonCMS Introduced
events.subtitle: April 2022
events.description: The first preview of the TachyonCMS Desktop Editor was released, as an Electron appliation created from a Quasar project. It set the tone for local-first, unlimited content management.

events.title: The First Websites Published with TachyonCMS
events.subtitle: April 2022
events.description: The first websites were published using TachyonCMS technology. That technology will power all of our content needs gong fowards, a SaaS version is coming soon.
